page.title: 10ST EDMUNDS SCHOOL,FLEETWOOD
page.content: The school was originally built as an infant school,and annexe to St.Wulstan's,another school in Fleetwood.It was built twenty-six years ago and the junior wing was built ten years ago. There are,at the moment,eighty-six pupils and four teachers. The pupils,whose ages range from five to eleven years,are divided into four classes each with approximately twenty-two children.Each class have pupils with an age range of two years. The pupils mostly live in Fleetwood. The school colours are red,grey and white. Corporal punishment is not used.Most punishment is in the form of discussion or loss of privileges. The head's hopes for the future include the employment of a part-time teacher.
